thread.title: Stewart-Haas Racing files appeal of penalties, Childers suspension
thread.title_full: Stewart-Haas Racing files appeal of penalties, Childers suspension

title: Stewart-Haas Racing files appeal of penalties, Childers suspension
text:
Mar 24, 2017 at 9:01a ET 0Shares 
Rodney Childers will be on the pit box for Kevin Harvick this weekend at Auto Club Speedway as Stewart-Haas Racing announced their appeal of the No. 4 Ford’s penalty following the Camping World 500 at Phoenix Raceway. 
The one-race suspension to Childers was part of the penalty following an unapproved track bar assembly found on the No. 4 Ford on Wednesday at NASCAR’s R&D Center. Along with the suspension, a $25,000 fine for Childers, an encumbered finish for Harvick, and the loss of 10 driver and owner points for the team were also handed down. 
“Stewart-Haas Racing has officially requested an appeal hearing regarding the penalties levied against the No. 4 team and have also requested a deferral of the penalties until the appeal process is complete,” Stewart-Haas Racing said in a statement. 
With NASCAR accepting the deferral, Childers won’t miss a race until the appeals process is complete, and if NASCAR upholds the initial penalties. 
Harvick has been one of the dominant drivers at Auto Club, leading 176 laps in the past two races and finishing second both times. He won the race in 2011 and has finished in the top 10 in six of the last eight races at the track.
